common_issues.title: Pieces OS Connection Issues in VS Code and Extensions
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing difficulties connecting to Pieces OS from VS Code, particularly within remote environments like Docker containers. This is due to recent changes in Pieces OS networking. Solutions include using custom DNS entries, modifying host files, and ensuring the latest VS Code extension is installed. The Pieces team is actively addressing these issues and improving compatibility.

related_issues.title: Seems like you are running VS Code in a remote environment (VS Code running remote docker container)
related_issues.text: Seems like you are running VS Code in a remote environment (VS Code running remote docker container) ### Software VS Code ### Operating System / Platform macOS ### Your Pieces OS Version 11.02 ### Early Access Program - [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature. ### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug. I'm having the same problem as this: https://github.com/pieces-app/support/issues/269 Using VS Code project within a docker container and getting this message: > Woops! It seems like you are running VS Code in a remote environment & Pieces for VS Code cannot connect to Pieces OS. Please refer to our documentation on how to resolve this issue. ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/ffeb53fd-0787-4bc2-9faf-c5f3d179294b) Pieces OS version: ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/640d35af-6106-4717-9269-c51205ff23fb) I followed this guide but with no luck: https://docs.pieces.app/product-highlights-and-benefits/connecting-to-a-remote-pieces-os-instance LAN IP: VS Code settings, pieces custom URL: ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/aaed7eb8-36e7-49cb-b6e0-84271adb8027) What else can I try? Thanks! ## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation: **Key Points Raised:** * malanciault is unable to connect to Pieces OS from their VS Code DevContainer. * The issue persists even when no project is open. * The problem seems to be related to Pieces OS listening on a loopback interface by default. * Connecting through "host.docker.internal" doesn't work with Copilot webview tool windows. **Problems Identified:** * Networking changes in Pieces OS version 11.0.0 causing connection issues. * Default listening interface changed to loopback for security reasons. * Resolution through "host.docker.internal" not supported for webview tool windows. **Solutions Proposed/Implemented:** * Patch for VSCode plugin to allow listening on all interfaces. * Workaround using a custom DNS entry and modifying hosts file. * Releasing VSCode extension version 2.0.1 with the patch. **Current Status/Outcome:** * VSCode extension 2.0.1 released and tested successfully in DevContainers. * malanciault still experiences issues with connection despite updating plugin. * A video call is scheduled to resolve the issue further. **Additional Notes:** * The conversation highlights the importance of clear communication and collaboration between users and developers. * The issue demonstrates the challenges involved in addressing compatibility issues across different environments. * The proposed solutions offer different approaches to resolve the connection issues.

- but same time windsurf not working

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/15ce268f-0d03-4f26-92af-53ce66292309)

## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation:

**Key Points Raised:**

* Users experiencing issues with Pieces for VS Code extension: messages not sending, crashes.
* Two possible causes: PiecesOS crash or VS Code connection loss.
* Need to isolate the issue to determine the root cause.

**Problems Identified:**

* Users encountering problems sending messages in Pieces for VS Code.
* Outdated version of the extension available in the open-source marketplace.
* Lag between updates in open-source marketplace and official VS Code marketplace.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Isolate the issue by sending a message through the Pieces for Developers Desktop application.
* Uninstall outdated open-source marketplace version and install latest version from official VS Code marketplace.
* Update open-source marketplace with latest version of the extension.
* Automate CI pipeline for updating extension in open-source marketplace.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Latest version of the extension (2.0.1) is available in Open VSX.
* Issue resolved with workaround of installing the latest version.
* CI pipeline updated to automate future updates.

**Additional Notes:**

* Issue was closed after a few days as a workaround was available.
* It is recommended to use the official VS Code marketplace for the most up-to-date version of the extension.

**In Summary:**

The conversation describes an issue with the Pieces for VS Code extension where users were experiencing problems sending messages. The issue was caused by an outdated version of the extension available in the open-source marketplace. The solution involved installing the latest version from the official VS Code marketplace and updating the CI pipeline to automate future updates in the open-source marketplace. The issue was resolved and the conversation was closed.

related_issues.title: Chrome Extension Fills Developer Console with Errors
related_issues.text: Chrome Extension Fills Developer Console with Errors ### Software Web Extension ### Operating System / Platform macOS ### Your Pieces OS Version 11.0.3 ### Early Access Program - [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature. ### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug. It appears the browser extension is sniffing a bunch of local ports - starting with 1000. This is a bit concerning, and a little invasive, but I do have the Pieces OS running, and it does finally get a response at a high port. This fills my devtools console tab, degrading my development experience by clouding errors I'm looking for in my own app. For a product designed to enhance my development experience I'm marking this as a bug. ## GitHub Issue Summary **Title:** Network errors flooding dev console **Author:** lorenwest **Date:** December 30, 2024 **Issue:** - Pieces OS extension's network calls were flooding the user's development console with error messages even when handled silently. - This interfered with debugging and caused inconvenience for the user. **Key Points Raised:** - The behavior was introduced after recent updates to Pieces OS and resulted from checking for Pieces OS API across different ports. - While user privacy was not compromised, the constant error messages were considered intrusive and undesirable. **Solutions Proposed:** - Hide or suppress error messages from inactive port checks within the Pieces OS extension. - Provide users with an option to hide network messages in the development console settings. **Solutions Implemented:** - Pieces OS team investigated the issue and identified it as a potential Chrome bug. - Due to the uncertainty of the bug's resolution, they offered users the option to hide network messages in the dev console settings. **Current Status:** - The issue remains unresolved, but a workaround is available for users. - A potential fix might be included in a future update, depending on Chrome fixing the underlying bug.

related_issues.title: Pieces OS Does not recognize folders or files
related_issues.text:
Pieces OS Does not recognize folders or files
### Software

Desktop Application, VS Code, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

PiecesOS 11.0.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

So until about a weekish ago, Everything would work smoothly, except for some other issues that did annoy me, but I had workarounds for them. Those issues was pieces os not working after a while. Not a big deal since I would just close it in task manager and reopen it once it was all closed to force a hard restart of the whole system. But, now (thanks for listening to my little rant up there) there is an issue that I cannot workaround. For some reason pieces cannot get any context from any files or folders, and its getting pretty annoying to the fact that I have started using other softwares because at least they can look at the files and suggest changes or edits that actually have something to do with my code. I believe this happened ever since i updated pieces os about 2-3 updates ago, but cannot pinpoint any specific cause. Another cause may be that fact that I downloaded Ollama but never really used it.
## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary

**Key Points Raised:**

* User (RamanBaig) experiences difficulty getting Pieces to read file content despite recognizing the files' names. This issue was frustrating, especially for files with thousands of lines of code.
* RamanBaig confirmed that Long Term Memory was enabled, tried different foundation models, and experienced the issue with all folders and files.

**Problems Identified:**

* Reading file content within Pieces was not working consistently.
* Difficulty reproducing the issue for troubleshooting.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Samantha (sam-at-pieces) requested additional information to reproduce the issue.
* Samantha proposed a call with RamanBaig to gather more details.
* Mark (mark-at-pieces) offered his calendar availability for a call if RamanBaig was unable to schedule with Samantha.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue was still under investigation and a resolution was not yet reached.
* A call was scheduled between RamanBaig and Mark to further troubleshoot the problem.

**Additional Notes:**

* The issue seemed to occur regardless of the foundation model used.
* RamanBaig was using Windows 11 Home, 24H2.
* The specific file size and file content were not identified. 
* The user was open to troubleshooting and provided all requested information.

related_issues.title: Unable to generate personal shareable links for 6+ months
related_issues.text:
Unable to generate personal shareable links for 6+ months
### Software

Desktop Application, Web Extension, VS Code, Sharing Web App

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

10.1.12

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I've been unable to generate shareable personal links and utilize the web sharing app since before June '24. I've created an issue about this twice before, and the last time was just completely disregarded and it was closed out.

Here is the screenshot from within my Pieces Desktop when trying to generate a personal link, as well as generate a GitHub Gist:

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/0966a1a9-3076-4d9b-9006-88a14673cc9f)
## GitHub Issue Summary


### Key Points

* **Issue:** Shareable links were not working for some users.
* **Reported by:** tombinga on 2024-11-07.
* **Cause:** Stale infrastructure powering the feature.


### Solutions

* **Immediate:** Mark (mark-at-pieces) offered to diagnose individual clouds and clean them up for users experiencing issues (2024-11-07 and 2024-11-08).
* **Long-term:** Major upgrades and infrastructure improvements planned for Shareable Links and cloud features, estimated December 2024 and included in the 10.1.13 release around November 19-21st, 2024.


### Outcome

* The original shareable links issue appears to be resolved as of November 12th, 2024.
* A new problem arose with generating GitHub Gists using Shareable Links in January 2025 (version 11.0.3). 
* This issue requires further investigation and is being tracked in a separate thread.


### Current Status

* Users experiencing issues with Shareable Links in version 11.0.3 should file a new issue and provide logs and version information as requested (2025-01-06).

The detailed list of changes is not quite ready yet; however, it will be here shortly. (I will post them here when they are)

Please, if you have any questions about the release or are having trouble updating to the latest, comment in this thread, and we can help you out!!

related_issues.title: Long-Term Memory Feature Not Working on Linux
related_issues.text:
Long-Term Memory Feature Not Working on Linux
### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

### Description
I'm experiencing issues with the Long-Term Memory feature on Linux. While the Discord team has confirmed that this feature should be available on Linux, the Pieces OS interface explicitly shows that the feature is not available for Linux systems.

### Current Behavior
- Pieces OS shows a message indicating Long-Term Memory is not available for Linux
- Long-Term Memory functionality does not work on the Linux platform
- Other operating systems appear to have this feature working correctly

### Expected Behavior
- Long-Term Memory feature should be available and functional on Linux, as confirmed by the Discord team

### Evidence
- [Discord communication confirming feature availability](https://discord.com/channels/1098986658851999776/1320479548797882430/1320643614443048971)

recommendations: **Prioritize LTM and File Context Issues:** Allocate additional resources to investigate and resolve the recurring issues related to Long-Term Memory (LTM) and Pieces OS's ability to access and utilize file content.  These issues are causing significant user frustration and hindering core product functionality.

**Improve LTM User Education:** Develop comprehensive documentation and tutorials specifically focused on LTM prompting techniques, particularly for Linux users. This will help users understand how to effectively utilize LTM and reduce support tickets related to its functionality.

**Address Pieces OS Connection Issues:** Continue to prioritize resolving connection issues between Pieces OS and various IDEs, especially in remote environments like Docker containers. This includes investigating custom DNS entries, host file modifications, and ensuring seamless compatibility with the latest IDE extensions.

**Monitor Plugin Updates and Compatibility:** Implement a more robust system for testing and communicating plugin updates, ensuring compatibility with new Pieces OS releases. This will help prevent issues arising from outdated or incompatible plugins.

**Investigate and Resolve Linux-Specific Issues:** Dedicate resources to thoroughly test and address the disproportionate number of issues reported by Linux users, particularly those related to LTM functionality and plugin compatibility. This may involve collaborating with the Linux community and optimizing Pieces OS for different distributions.

**Enhance Bug Reporting and Tracking:** Implement a more structured bug reporting system that captures detailed system information, logs, and steps to reproduce the issue. This will help developers identify and resolve bugs more efficiently.

**Improve Communication on Known Issues:** Proactively communicate known issues and workarounds to users through release notes, blog posts, or a dedicated status page. This will keep users informed and reduce support tickets related to already identified problems.

**Consider User Feedback on UI/UX:**  While not a major issue in this dataset, be receptive to user feedback regarding UI/UX elements, such as the reported intrusive popup URL and unnecessary update prompts. Addressing these minor annoyances can significantly improve user satisfaction.
